headline: Copycat Starbucks Pumpkin Bread
description: This copycat Starbucks pumpkin bread recipe makes a delicious, moist loaf flavored with warm spices of cinnamon, nutmeg, and clove for a delicious fall treat.
name: Copycat Starbucks Pumpkin Bread

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease an 8 1/2-x4 1/2-inch loaf pan.
Combine flour, baking soda, nutmeg, cinnamon, cloves, baking powder, and salt in a large bowl; mix well and set aside.

Beat eggs, white sugar, brown sugar, and vanilla extract in a large bowl with an electric mixer on high speed until combined, about 30 seconds. Beat in pumpkin and oil. Add flour mixture; mix until batter is blended and smooth. Pour batter into the prepared loaf pan.
Bake in the preheated oven until the top is dark brown and a toothpick inserted into the center of the bread comes out clean, about 70 minutes.
Let bread cool in the pan for about 30 minutes, then invert onto a wire rack to cool completely. Cut into 1-inch-thick slices.

review.reviewBody: I used gluten free flour, and it was amazing. I would cut the cloves back to 1/2 a teaspoon but my husband loves the spices.
Terrific recipe. I too used a full cup of pumpkin due to a gravity based incident while measuring. Topped with sanding sugar and chopped walnuts at my son’s request. A big hit with us all. Thank you!
added chocolate chips and used some applesauce instead of 1/2 the oil will 100% make again

Delicious. I made it with 1 cup pumpkin and 1/2 cup oil. The recipe as written might make it just a bit more delightfully moist, but the reduced oil was more than acceptable, and I'll continue to make it that way.

I made a loaf of it twice. It rises beautifully and doesn't have that dense taste as other fruit based quick breads. A few changes I made to the recipe: -I reduced the 1 cup of sugar to 3/4 cup, so when I added the brown sugar it's an equal 1 full cup of it. -I added 1/4 cups of chopped pecans to the batter. You can easily throw in some chia seeds to give it more fiber if you wish. Overall it's a delicious base for any quick bread and I recommend smearing it with some cream cheese.

We made this last night for breakfast this morning. They were a hugh hit, but with a 4 and 5 yo I changed it up a bit and made them in a muffin pan for easier consumption. We cut the recipe in half to try and see what we thought before making a full batch. We'll be making a full batch this weekend.

Yummy bread! No changes are needed, but just for personal preference and following other reviewers’ suggestions, I used 1/2 tsp cloves and 1 1/2 tsp cinnamon. I also used 1 full cup of pumpkin and 1/2 cup oil. I used 1 cup brown sugar and no white sugar. I also added a oat streusel topping. Delicious!

Wow... such a great treat for this cold winter day. I did change things up a bit. We don't like cloves here so we used pumpkin pie spice and used 2 tsp only Then I used only 3 small eggs, only 1 cup of sugar and 2/3 cup oil instead adding more pumpkin. Took 1hour 5 min to bake and we are all happy! Beautiful loaf, beautiful flavor- this is a great keeper!

*Don't forget to cover with foil.
*Increase Pumpkin to 1 cup
*Decrease sugar by 1/4 cup.
*Add chopped walnuts or pecans.
Was not moist. Recipe fail.
Tastes GREAT! Comes out perfectly every time.

Wonderful recipe! I followed others' advice and increased pumpkin to 1 cup (I used fresh, since it has a milder flavor definitely need the full cup), reduced oil to 2/3 cup (and used some olive oil as healthier than regular vegetable - can easily do more than half with no real difference in flavor), and reduced the amount of clove. For clove, I found 1/2 tsp was actually too light. Go with a little more, say a heaping 1/2 tsp or even 3/4. Quite yummy! And stayed moist for a couple of days after.
All we could taste was clove ,,

I knew right after adding the tsp of ground cloves that it was too much. Way too much spice for me. All I can taste is clove. If I make it again I’ll prob eliminate the cloves all together. I also substituted most of the oil for apple sauce and that worked well and maintained moisture.
Best pumpkin bread I’ve ever had.

Full disclosure, I didn't make this exact recipe but the one I do swear by is almost identical except for the brown sugar - can't wait to add some brown sugar to my next batch tho. 

This is a great recipe as it stands. Over the years (with the aforementioned recipe) , I have made a few variations. One, no oil - replaced with apple sauce and then reduce the sugar by about a half cup. Also, I add raisins, cranberries, pecans, and walnuts to some of my batches. Yum yum. :)
Delicious recipe, definitely will make again but will reduce the cloves in half.
THANK YOU!!! I've been wanting to learn how to make this and not have to go to Starbucks and spend 8 bucks on pumpkin bread!
Great moist bread. Very flavorful.
I used 1 cup pumpkin and 1/2 cup oil as some suggested. I didn't have clove so I left it out. It's tasty spread with cream cheese.

This is EXACTLY like Starbucks pumpkin bread IF you lower the bake time to about 60 minutes and tent it for the last 30 minutes. Moist, delicious and the whole loaf costs a couple of bucks as opposed to $4 a slice! I'm forever done with that place anyway, so thank you for creating this recipe! We have 6 year old twins who are pumpkin bread experts and they say this is even better than theirs. Great recipe!
Fabulous! Very moist. I sprinkled roasted pepitas on top.
it was soooooo good! i added a teaspoon of pumpkin pie spice as a substitute for clove and it still tasted great

Made the recipe exactly as it says but used 3 TSP of pumpkin spice instead of the 3 spices it calls for. I would use 1 TSP more next time. And I added chocolate chips and pumpkin seeds as a garnish so my LO will eat it. This recipe turned out perfectly! This will definitely be my go to pumpkin loaf recipe!

I made a few substitutions to this recipe: used Paleo flour in place of ap flour, stevia sugar cane blend in place of white sugar (used half as much), and dark brown sugar. I also toasted some pumpkin seeds a chopped them up as a topping. This is the best pumpkin bread I’ve ever made!
It came out great but 70 min is way too long. I baked it 55 min and I’ll probably try 50 next time.

I made it for my best friend for her birthday today. She absolutely loves it! No one in her family and then of her other friends baked breads and she only has two favorites and pumpkin bread is one of them.
Loved the bread! So moist and delicious!
It is so good! My children love it , to finish it off , I would add more nutmeg, and when it is finished cooking, before serving, and a pinch of powdered sugar

I followed the recipe without substitutions and my bread baked well and came out very moist. I absolutely love fall spices like cinnamon, nutmeg and cloves but I will say I think the clove is a bit strong. The recipe as is is delicious but the next time I make it I will probably put in a little less clove. Overall, I would say this recipe provides an excellent foundation for pumpkin bread that you can tweak here and there to your liking.

Excellent! I made this a few times and it’s always good. Per comments, I ended up reducing cloves to 1/2 teaspoon, increased pumpkin purée to 1 cup, decreased oil to 1/2 cup. I also used 1/2 cup white sugar and 1/2 cup brown sugar, which is less overall sugar than original recipe.

DRY AND NO flavor
YES i followed directions exactly
another recipe copykat calls for 1/4 cup MORE pumpkin, i wonder if that where the flavor went

Wow! Amazing flavor! I make my own pumpkin by cooking and freezing what comes out of our garden, so I just used up last years bounty. I made sure to take out the water after freezing the grated pumpkin. Tasted great! My family really enjoyed this - saving the recipe to make again after I process this year's bounty from the garden! Yum!
I changed the oil to butter and doubled it, added an egg, added 1/2 teaspoon ground ginger. It turned out amazing!! So moist!!
Great recipe! I followed the advice on the site and increased pumpkin to 1 cup and decreased the oil to 1/2 cup. I used 1/4 cup of Truvia instead of 1/2 cup white sugar

I can’t say that I’ve ever had Starbucks pumpkin bread. Lemon loaf, yes. But I can’t recall ever having pumpkin. This loaf baked up big and fluffy. I’m not a fan of clove so I reduced the amount to a pinch and added a 1/2 tsp of ginger. I can’t say it’s the best loaf of pumpkin bread I’d ever had but I will say it is not super sweet (a plus) and moist. Watch your bake time. Mine was complete at 50 minutes.
Excellent recipe.. delicious ..

Came out BEAUTIFULLY!! I have been using this site to get either temperatures, recipe bases, or the occasional full recipe from for over 4 years, and this is one of the best I've ever made!! Great job on this one!!

This is extremely similar to the Starbucks pumpkin bread, and it’s an awesome recipe that I will be saving! I used the King Arthur Measure for measure gluten-free flour, and it tastes just like Starbucks’ recipe. I read through a review that said to use a half of cup of oil, and the entire can of pumpkin so I did that. I also? subbed in 3.5 teaspoons of pumpkin pie spice instead of the other spices listed in the recipe. I baked it for close to 70 minutes. It is moist and delicious! Excited for my husband to try it when he gets home from work.

Fall favourite in our house! I use spelt flour and it tastes great. Hot tip: when using a large can of pumpkin, separate out the rest into 3/4C portions and freeze in Tupperware containers - makes making next loaves super quick and easy!
added some pumpkin-spice flavouring spice as well. makes it extra festive.
I’ve made this recipe 3 times now! For a more moist consistency, I hand-mixed all the liquids and did a final mix before putting it in my baking dish!
Half the white sugar, half the clove, added more cinnamon.

This bread is very tasty but it does not compare to Starbucks pumpkin bread. This taste more like spice bread than pumpkin. I would add more pumpkin than it says. Overall a good bread just needs more pumpkin flavor.
not my favorite. the spices made it taste super strong. Not sure if it’s the nutmeg or the cloves but one (or both) are really overpowering.
I love this recipe, it is a little denser than the Starbucks one, but still really good!
I loved it and I added a little bit of more pumpkin. I also added pumpkin seeds on top.
Very good but not enough pumpkin
Only change I made was 3/4 cup of white sugar instead of a whole cup. Have to admit, I don't know what Starbuck's pumpkin loaf is like, but this tasted very good and didn't last long.
Although tasty, this pumpkin bread was quite dense, as described. My preference is for a lighter, yet still moist pumpkin bread, so I do not think I will be making this recipe again.

This bread was amazing I love the Starbucks Pumpkin Bread and this is very close to it! Those that said it was dry must’ve over baked it! I followed the recipe exactly and even added the toasted pumpkin seeds on top and it was super moist and delicious! Everyone enjoyed it and I will be my new go-to recipe for pumpkin bread! Thanks!
No changes. It’s perfect.

I definitely will make it again and again. Great recipe. I personally like it to be less oily so I used 1/2 oil and 1/2 melted butter the second time I baked this . Worked great. I also added a tat of cardamon just because I got it in my pantry and want to use it before it gets old. But all this is not necessary as the basic recipe is great.
I too reduced cloves from 1tsp to 1/2 tsp and increased vanilla from 1/2 to 1 tsp. This pumpkin bread is outstanding! I have probably tried 20 different recipes and this one is best by far!!!
Very moist and delicious! Will make again.
Delicious! Will definitely make this recipe again.
the Pumpkin Bread is awesome. Soft and flavor.

I used 1/2 cup applesauce and 1/4 veg. oil instead of all veg. oil. I also cut the cloves to 1/2 tsp and upped the cinnamon to 1-1/2 tsp. Cut the white sugar to 3/4 cup and used 1/4 cup coconut sugar instead of brown sugar. Threw a few walnuts on top. Very good! Will make again.
I live in Brazil, then I used butternut pumpkin to made a puree.

Followed recipe as it appears. I did use a baking spice from Savory Spice, which has a pungent collection of spices. The pumpkin bread was great. My husband is not a great fan of pumpkin, but loved this bread. Will make it often.

I make this frequently for my grandchildren. Today, I substituted whole wheat pastry flour, cut the white sugar by a third, and added about 1/2 to 3/4 cup of smooth almond butter, just to give it a nutritional boost. I also doubled the amounts for the spices. The results are very good.

This was just like the Starbucks pumpkin bread! Very easy to make and delicious! I used coconut sugar instead of brown sugar (same amount) and cut ground cloves amount in half, increased cinnamon to heaping tsp. REALLY REALLY AMAZING!

This was a good recipe. I like that it's low sugar and I liked the swirl of cinnamon on top. I added nuts to the top too. My kids would prefer more sugar of course. My husband wanted more spices. But it's a good compromise. I made it with GF flours, brown rice, chickpea, almond meal, and some Bob's. Will make it again. I would like it to be a little more dense next time. I agree with those that thought it needed more pumpkin, maybe some oil or butter?
I used allspice instead of cloves because there was none near me but it came out very moist and tasty. Definitely will make again but with nuts on top for an added texture.
I’ve been using this recipe for a couple of years now. Excellent density, moistness and not too sweet. Great topped with whipped cream cheese, or not.

Delicious and addictive! I substituted 3 1/2 t. pumpkin spice plus an extra 1/2 t. cinnamon because I'm not crazy about a strong clove flavor. I also used 3/4 C white sugar and 1/4 C brown sugar to cut down on the sugar. You won't miss the extra sugar a bit especially if you make the basic cream cheese frosting on the all-recipes website. Everyone that tastes it asks for the recipe ! Moist and about as perfect a pumpkin bread as you can find. It does taste similar to Everything Bunt Cakes pumpkin cake if you've tasted that.
I made it yesterday and let me tell you. It taste amazing!!!! Great recipe
Cloves were too strong maybe il try lesser amount mext time
This bread was super dry, not dense and chewy like the Starbucks ones. I'll probably use a different recipie next time
This was delicious! Prior to baking, I topped mine with pepitas to make a crunchy top. Came together quick, made house smell great while baked, and taste great. Make it!
I added all spice to the listed ingredients as well. This bread is one of the best pumpkin breads I have made. Will definitely make it again.
Best pumpkin bread!
Best pumpkin bread!
added walnut pieces and chocolate chips- delish!

I am allergic to eggs so 
I used Egg Replacers. It probably didn't bake up quite as high and light as it would have with eggs but it tasted delicious and as I am also allergic to milk products this recipe works for me.
Very delicious. I added half the amount of cloves, but kept everything else the same. Very moist
Made exactly as shown. Only thing was 1tsp cloves were too strong for our taste but It was super delicious and my 4 year old ate 2 slices. Made it twice this week but 2nd time I cut cloves to 1/2tsp.
I made this as muffins instead of bread and it turned out great. Will definitely make again!
It's delicious!!!!! I'm making it again.
Bomb digity.
I added 1 tsp of ground ginger and an extra 1/2 cup of sugar to the recipe. Finish with a dusting of powdered sugar.
Good flavor, but I would not compare it to Starbucks. It was not very moist.

I loved this. The only changes I made was to use 1/2 C applesauce in place of half of the oil, and 1 C of wheat flour. I also added pecans.
Really delicious and the smell!!!! So good.
Deliciously spot-on! My family loved it and I’ll be making it again and again throughout the holidays!
I shared it and ended up making loaves for others because they enjoyed it so much. It truly is a wonderful recipe to make. Make extra and share, your friends will love you for it.

This is GREAT bread! I used 1 cup fresh pumpkin puree and 1/2 cup oil. I had pumpkin puree to use up and it's liquidity so that's all I changed. I found the clove to be just right. I changed nothing else. I was worried at how runny the batter was, but it came out perfect at 60 minutes.

I love this bread but I did make 2 modifications. I increased pumpkin to 1 cup and decreased oil to 1/2 cup. It came out much less greasy and more pumpkin-ey. I also added a pecan/Brown sugar/ oat /butter streusal on the top to add crunch. Yummy!
This is delicious and very moist. My kids love it and yes, it tastes like the bread at Starbucks. I prefer less of the clove taste though and will reduce it to about 1/2 in the future.
I used allspice because I didnt have ground cloves. Starbucks Pumpkin bread is my favorite and this recipe was very good. I'm happy.
No changes and yes, I will make it again.
Wow. This is the best pumpkin loaf ever. So moist and delicious. Rave reviews from hubby with this recipe.

I made this bread and it is Very Mouthwatering!! It's very Dense & Moist. The spice isn't to much for me, its just right. To prevent sticking i used Cisco shortening and flour. The Best bread i tried!
I didn't care for this recipe. The amount of ground cloves and oil was too overpowering and made it greasy for my taste.

I tried two other pumpkin bread recipes and they just didn't do it for me. Yet, apparently, third time IS the charm because this one's IT! I wouldn't say it's exactly SB flavored, but it's definitely extremely close. Im only removing one star because I would do slightly less sugar (I have the opposite of a sweet tooth) and maybe throw in some pumpkin spice to make it even more flavorful. Either way, it's an EXCELLENT recipe.
This is my new favorite pumpkin bread recipe. It’s moist and flavorful. Absolutely delish!
This was very much like Starbucks pumpkin bread. Super moist and delicious!!
This tastes exactly like the Pumpkin Bread you can purchase at a Starbucks Store.
Excellent! Lovely spicy flavor. Made exactly according to directions but threw some chopped walnuts in at the end. Will definitely make again. Mine was ready in 55 minutes.
Made as written except skipped cloves as did not have and added walnuts to the batter. Very good. Not super sweet which I like. Will make again.
